meanings.definition: Trocking (verb): the act of moving or traveling quickly and steadily
meanings.sent1: She was trocking down the street to catch the bus.
meanings.sent2: The train was trocking along the tracks towards the city.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was trocking through the park, trying to find its hidden acorns.
meanings.sent4: Time was trocking forward, never looking back.
meanings.sent5: The river trocked steadily towards the waterfall, its current strong and unwavering.

meanings.definition: Trocking (noun): a fast and steady movement or journey
meanings.sent1: The trocking of the horses' hooves echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent2: The trocking of the train could be heard from a distance.
meanings.sent3: The trocking of the clock's pendulum was oddly soothing.
meanings.sent4: The trocking of the metronome kept the musicians in perfect rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The trocking of the waterfall created a calming background noise in the forest.

meanings.definition: Trocking (adjective): relating to or characteristic of a fast and steady pace
meanings.sent1: The trocking pace of the marathon runners impressed the spectators.
meanings.sent2: The trocking rhythm of the music kept everyone dancing all night.
meanings.sent3: The trocking heartbeat of the patient indicated a healthy cardiovascular system.
meanings.sent4: The trocking sound of the typewriter filled the room with a sense of productivity.
meanings.sent5: The trocking speed of the cheetah made it the fastest animal on land.
